trans-unit.source: Stores a set of four integers that represent the location and size of a rectangle

A rectangle is defined by its <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height%2A>, and upper-left corner represented by the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Location%2A> property.
To draw rectangles, you need a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object and a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> object.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object provides the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawRectangle%2A> method, and the <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> object stores features of the line, such as color and width.
The units the rectangle is drawn in is determined by the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.PageUnit%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.PageScale%2A> properties of the graphics object used for drawing.
The default unit is pixels.

To draw a <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle> filled with color, you need a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object and an object derived from <xref:System.Drawing.Brush> such as <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush> or <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.LinearGradientBrush>.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object provides the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.FillRectangle%2A> method and the <xref:System.Drawing.Brush> object provides the color and fill information.
For more advanced shapes, use a <xref:System.Drawing.Region> object.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> class with the specified location and size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that represents the upper-left corner of the rectangular region.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the width and height of the rectangular region.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> class with the specified location and size.
The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.

Gets the y-coordinate that is the sum of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Y"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height"></xref> property values of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.

The value of the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Bottom%2A> property represents the y-coordinate of the first point at the bottom edge of the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle> that is not contained in the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>.
The y-coordinate that is the sum of <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Y"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.

Converts the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure to a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure by rounding the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> values to the next higher integer values.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure to be converted.
Returns a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
Determines if the specified point is contained within this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The containing rectangle must be normalized for this method to return accurate results.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> to test.
This method returns `true` if the point represented by pt is contained within this structure; otherwise `false`.
Determines if the rectangular region represented by rect is entirely contained within this structure.
The containing rectangle must be normalized for this method to return accurate results.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to test.
This method returns `true` if the rectangular region represented by rect is entirely contained within this structure; otherwise `false`.
Determines if the specified point is contained within this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The containing rectangle must be normalized for this method to return accurate results.
The x-coordinate of the point to test.
The y-coordinate of the point to test.
This method returns `true` if the point defined by x and y is contained within this structure; otherwise `false`.
Represents a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure with its properties left uninitialized.
A rectangle is defined by its width, height and upper-left corner.
Tests whether obj is a structure with the same location and size of this structure.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to test.
This method returns `true` if obj is a structure and its , , , and properties are equal to the corresponding properties of this structure; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure with the specified edge locations.
This method creates a <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle> with the specified upper-left and lower-right corners.
The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The new <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that this method creates.
Returns the hash code for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
For information about the use of hash codes, see <xref href="System.Object.GetHashCode"></xref> .
An integer that represents the hash code for this rectangle.
Gets or sets the height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Changing the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height%2A> property will also cause a change in the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Bottom%2A> property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>.
The units the rectangle is drawn in is determined by the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.PageUnit%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.PageScale%2A> properties of the graphics object used for drawing.
The default unit is pixels.
The height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
Enlarges this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> by the specified amount.
This method enlarges this rectangle, not a copy of it.
The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis.

For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is enlarged by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.
The amount to inflate this rectangle.
Enlarges this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> by the specified amount.
This method enlarges this rectangle, not a copy of it.
The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis.

For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is enlarged by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.
If either `x` or `y` is negative, the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle> structure is deflated in the corresponding direction.
The amount to inflate this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> horizontally.
The amount to inflate this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> vertically.
Creates and returns an enlarged copy of the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The copy is enlarged by the specified amount.
The original <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure remains unmodified.
This method makes a copy of `rect`, enlarges the copy, and then returns the enlarged copy.
The rectangle is enlarged in both directions along an axis.

For example, if a 50 by 50 rectangle is enlarged by 50 in the x-axis, the resultant rectangle will be 150 units long (the original 50, the 50 in the minus direction, and the 50 in the plus direction) maintaining the rectangle's geometric center.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> with which to start.
This rectangle is not modified.
The amount to inflate this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> horizontally.
The amount to inflate this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> vertically.
The enlarged <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
Returns a third <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that represents the intersection of two other <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures.
If there is no intersection, an empty <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> is returned.
A rectangle to intersect.
A rectangle to intersect.
A that represents the intersection of a and b.
Replaces this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> with the intersection of itself and the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> with which to intersect.
Determines if this rectangle intersects with rect.
The rectangle to test.
This method returns `true` if there is any intersection, otherwise `false`.
Tests whether all numeric properties of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> have values of zero.

This property returns `true` if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.X"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Y"></xref> properties of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> all have values of zero; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the x-coordinate of the left edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The x-coordinate of the left edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Gets or sets the coordinates of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that represents the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Adjusts the location of this rectangle by the specified amount.
This method adjusts the location of the upper-left corner horizontally by the x-coordinate of the specified point, and vertically by the y-coordinate of the specified point.
Amount to offset the location.
Adjusts the location of this rectangle by the specified amount.
The horizontal offset.
The vertical offset.
Tests whether two <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures have equal location and size.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that is to the left of the equality operator.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that is to the right of the equality operator.

This operator returns `true` if the two <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures have equal <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.X"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Y"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height"></xref> properties.
Tests whether two <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures differ in location or size.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that is to the left of the inequality operator.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that is to the right of the inequality operator.

This operator returns `true` if any of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.X"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Y"></xref>, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width"></xref> or <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Height"></xref> properties of the two <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures are unequal; otherwise `false`.

Gets the x-coordinate that is the sum of <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width"></xref> property values of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The value of the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Right%2A> property represents the x-coordinate of the first point at the right edge of the rectangle that is not contained in the rectangle.
The x-coordinate that is the sum of <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.X"></xref> and <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.

Converts the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> by rounding the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> values to the nearest integer values.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> to be converted.
The rounded interger value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
Gets or sets the size of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the width and height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Gets the y-coordinate of the top edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The y-coordinate of the top edge of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Converts the attributes of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> to a human-readable string.
A string that contains the position, width, and height of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure ¾ for example, {X=20, Y=20, Width=100, Height=50}
Converts the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> to a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> by truncating the <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> values.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> to be converted.
The truncated value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that contains the union of two <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures.

When one of the two rectangles is empty, meaning all of its values are zero, the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Union%2A> method returns a rectangle with a starting point of (0, 0), and the height and width of the non-empty rectangle.
For example, if you have two rectangles: A = (0, 0; 0, 0) and B = (1, 1; 2, 2), then the union of A and B is (0, 0; 2, 2).
A rectangle to union.
A rectangle to union.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure that bounds the union of the two <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structures.
Gets or sets the width of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Changing the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Width%2A> property will also cause a change in the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Right%2A> property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>.
The units the rectangle is drawn in is determined by the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.PageUnit%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.PageScale%2A> properties of the graphics object used for drawing.
The default unit is pixels.
The width of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Changing the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.X%2A> property will also cause a change in the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Right%2A> property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>.
The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
Changing the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Y%2A> property will also cause a change in the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle.Bottom%2A> property of the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>.
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> structure.
The default is 0.
